text:
- [Narrator] In the NFL,
tackling isn't just about
who brings down the ball character.
It's a complex evolving process
that unfolds throughout each play.

But traditional stats only
tell part of the story.
That's why the NFL
and AWS created Tackle Probability,
a groundbreaking AI powered metric
that can identify a missed tackle,

when and where that
tackle attempt took place,
and do it all in real time.

Inspired by submissions
from the Big Data Bowl,

building this stat required
five years of historical data
to train an AI model on AWS SageMaker

capable of processing millions
of data points per game,
tracking 20 different features for each

of the 11 defenders
every 10th of a second.
The result, a game changing stat
that provides unprecedented insights.

We can now quantify tackling
efficiency in ways never
before possible.
A defender can be credited
with 15 tackle attempts
in a game without a single miss.
Or we can measure

how many missed tackles
a running back forces.

All told there will be at
least 10 new stats from this
model for the NFL.

Coaches can now quantify
tackling efficiency
and identify players

who consistently put
themselves in the right
position to make the play.
And broadcasters can highlight

broken or made tackles
to fans in real time.
By leveraging AWS's AI tools

and engineers, the NFL
is taking tackle analysis
to the next level,
giving teams, broadcasters
and fans deeper insights into one
of football's most crucial skills.
